intro: Lucuma balansana, commonly known as the golden apple, is a tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, elongated fruit that turns a vibrant yellow when ripe. The fruit has a creamy, custard-like pulp that is rich in nutrients and has a sweet, nutty flavor. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is valued not only for its unique fruit but also for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
